blog.name: rose-grangerweasleyisbae
blog.title: Rose Granger-Weasley, my favorite lesbian
blog.description:
She/her, Slytherin, lesbian, dutch, 19 years old.

You can find my stuff under the "my writing" tag or on ao3 under the name donnarafiki

You can find my Ko-Fi link here in case you really like my stuff

tags: i hope the ending was sort of okay i'm not sure about it
title: Fresh Paint
body:
Warning! Mentions of depression (and an overdose of hurt/comfort fluff)

“Oh, I just can’t believe they’re getting married.” Harry sighed for the millionth time, with the biggest grin in the world on his face. He’d been like that for weeks after Ron and Hermione had gotten engaged, and now he was like it again because their wedding was in a few days and he had to work on his best man’s speech.

Draco tried to enjoy it, but he found it difficult. He was close friends with the bride and groom to be, but he struggled to be really happy and excited for them. In fact he struggled to be really happy and excited for anything. If Harry were to propose to him on the spot, he probably wouldn’t be able to be happy about it for more than a few hours. His head was just like that, ever since the war.

“You jealous, grumpy old bear of mine?” Harry chuckled and tackled him until he was pinned down on their bed, which took very little effort. The lack of energy was another thing that hadn’t left him after the war, and when he had bad days things just got a million times worse.

“Jealous of you, a little bit. But it doesn’t matter, this isn’t about me. Your best friends are getting married!” He tried to sound enthusiastic but in all honesty he had never sounded more fake in his life. Harry frowned and rolled off him, shooting him an inquisitive and worried look.

“What is it, Draco? You haven’t been truly happy for them ever since the announcement, don’t think I didn’t notice. Why can’t you be happy for them?”

“It’s not that I can’t be happy for them.” Draco sighed, not wanting to say what he was about to say but knowing that he didn’t really have an option. Harry wouldn’t back off until he had a proper reason. The man had to be sure Darco didn’t secretly hate his friends or something. “I just… Can’t be happy. Not longer than an hour or something. My brain just isn’t wired like that.”

“Draco you…” Harry reached out for him and pulled him into a firm embrace. Draco hated it. The hug was only a confirmation that Harry deserved better than him. The man was so bright and happy and intense, while Draco was just flat. Static. Empty. “You should be wired like that. It’s not normal to not be happy.”

“I know.” He closed his eyes to stop himself from seeing all the happy excitement drain from his lover’s face. This always happened. He always took people down with him. “But that doesn’t make it any less true. Some things just… Damage people. And I haven’t managed to fix myself. I’m not strong enough for that.”

Harry looked like he was going to argue, but Draco didn’t let him. “Now when I’m happy it’s always shallow and brief. Like putting paint on rotten woodwork. It’s going to look alright for awhile, but after just a few hours you can already see the first water stains leak through. That’s how my therapist put it, anyway. And she’s right, I think. All positive emotions just feel shallow, while the empty darkness just gets… Everywhere, on bad days.”

He took a deep breath, and admitted something he rarely did. “Today is a bad day.”

Harry didn’t respond to that for a very long time, until he rolled onto him and hugged him so hard Draco could hear his ribs creak. “Sometimes I just really wished there was more I could do for you. That there was more I could do to help.”

“Because dating a depressed person is exhausting.” Draco muttered, his thoughts accidentally voices by his lips. Harry almost gasped when he heard that.

“No Draco. Because it’s awful to see you hurt like this. Because I want you to be happy for you.” Harry cupped his cheeks, finally releasing his deadlock hug, and kissed him on the lips hard. “I hate seeing you like this not because you’re bothering me or getting me down, but because you feel shit and I don’t want you to.”

Draco let out a deep breath, closing his eyes. Harry had so many reasons to be annoyed with him, to ditch the entire relationship as a whole because Draco was such a mess, but all the man did was become more considerate. Become more gentle, make him more tea, try harder to stop him from dissociating. He was just so sweet, and Draco didn’t deserve him at all.

“I love you, Draco.” Harry began covering his face and neck with kisses, sucking on the skin here and there in an attempt to pull him out of his bad place. “You make me so fucking happy, I sometimes feel like I can’t handle the sheer amount of joy inside of me. I want that for you too. I want to make you just as happy as you make me. Please let me do that.”

A chuckle escaped Draco’s lips despite everything. “You’re impossible, Potter. Always trying to save everyone.”

“No, I don’t want to save you. I want to help you. I want to assist, because I know this is something that you have to beat yourself, but that doesn’t mean I can’t make you tea while you do that.” Harry abandoned his neck in favour of his lips and spend several minutes making very sure Draco knew who Harry wanted to make tea for. “I just want you to be happy. You deserve that and so much more.”

“I am happy, sort of. As close to happy as I can be right now.” A weak smile tugged on his lips as he saw the passion in Harry’s eyes. The determination of his lover made it almost impossible to keep believing that things wouldn’t get better. “Your mood can be quite infectious.”

Harry smiled along with him. “Fresh layer of paint.”

He nodded. “Fresh layer of paint.”

“But I think you’re overestimating how much rot there is. You’ve already improved so much since the first time we met.” Draco rolled his eyes. Harry always called the first time they met after the war ‘the first time they met’. He’d stopped correcting the man by now, he knew it served no point anyway. “I know you’re going to get there soon enough, babe. You’re so much stronger than you give yourself credit for.”

“I really don’t think that’s true.” He huffed, shaking his head at Harry’s never ending Gryffindor positivity. “But thanks.”

“You’re welcome.” Harry kissed his forehead and pulled him into a more gentle hug. “You’ll always be welcome. For the rest of your life.”

You deserve that and so much more.”

Harry smiled along with him. “Fresh layer of paint.”

He nodded. “Fresh layer of paint.”

“But I think you’re overestimating how much rot there is. You’ve already improved so much since the first time we met.” Draco rolled his eyes. Harry always called the first time they met after the war ‘the first time they met’. He’d stopped correcting the man by now, he knew it served no point anyway. “I know you’re going to get there soon enough, babe. You’re so much stronger than you give yourself credit for.”

“I really don’t think that’s true.” He huffed, shaking his head at Harry’s never ending Gryffindor positivity. “But thanks.”

“You’re welcome.” Harry kissed his forehead and pulled him into a more gentle hug. “You’ll always be welcome. For the rest of your life.”

blog.name: incorrecthogwartsmysteryquotes
blog.title: Incorrect quotes from "Hogwarts Mystery"
blog.description: The quotes are based on the characters from the game "Harry Potter: hogwarts mystery", because we can never have enough Harry Potter characters. Feel free to message me, submit something or send an ask about anything, except for pineapples. Tags are weird ok.

summary: Penny: How would you kill me if you could? MC: Um, I don't know. Push you down the Grand Staircase?Penny: No, seriously. They'd...
body:
Penny: How would you kill me if you could?

MC: Um, I don’t know. Push you down the Grand Staircase?

Penny: No, seriously. They’d come for you immediately.

MC: I don’t know. Flatter you to death. Okay, how would you kill me?

Penny: I’d paralyze you with saxitoxin and suffocate you in your sleep, chop you into the smallest bits I could manage, boil you down, put you in a blender, then take you to Potions in a flask and pour you into Merula’s cauldron.

blog.name: strugglinggryffindorkid
blog.title: That Struggling Gryffindor kid
blog.description: Can’t lift the feather. Won’t stop trying. Wingardium LeviOsa

body:
Dear person reading this,

Sometimes times get tough and things are rough. Sometimes you might feel upset because you can’t lift your feather. It may seem as if the world is against you. But I promise you that you will get through this. You won’t just survive it– YOU WILL THRIVE. You are glorious and you are magnificent and I am here for you. I believe in you, okay? Don’t forget that I am here rooting for you and cheering you on no matter what!

Love

Struggling Gryffindor Kid❤️

summary: harry potter character aesthetics: lightning era
title: harry potter character aesthetics: lightning era
body:
Harry Potter: thunderstorms, aftershave, crooked glasses, Muggle coffee shops, old newspapers, photo albums, unlocked cages, fire
Ron Weasley: eraser dust, rusted swords, aprons, soft  blankets, old-fashioned chess pieces, worn leather helmets, brick fireplaces, warm spices
Hermione Granger: scented candles, calligraphy pens, mint toothpaste, sparks, silverware, crumpled bedsheets, leather bookmarks, ginger
Ginny Weasley: fireworks, ripped jeans, glitter, dirty sneakers, bicycles, broomsticks, wooden roller coasters, watering cans
Neville Longbottom: small plants, shadows, bubble gum wrappers, untied shoes, sunlight, green tea, toads, denim jackets
Luna Lovegood: flower crowns, puddles, fertile soil, spilled paint, pianos, ashes, rainbows, sunflowers, lace, Ferris wheels
Draco Malfoy: crisp dollar bills, broken glass, smoke, potion bottles, peacock feathers, raindrops, cologne, belt buckles, lakes

summary: OK BUT LIKE AN AU WHERE SIRIUS HIDES IN MUGGLE LONDON.HE BECOMES A RENOWNED ACTOR ND USES A FAKE NAME.VOTED TIME'S MOST HANDSOME...
body:
OK BUT LIKE AN AU WHERE SIRIUS HIDES IN MUGGLE LONDON.HE BECOMES A RENOWNED ACTOR ND USES A FAKE NAME.VOTED TIME’S MOST HANDSOME MAN ALIVE
AND WHY NOT? WHAT THE HELL
HARRY IS THERE DOING HIS MATHS. TRAINING SNAKES FOR CIRCUSES AND STUF

AND THEN HIS LETTER COMES.

summary: I never really got the whole “Harry and Ginny should have named one of their children after Remus Lupin” thing- to me it was...
caption: I never really got the whole “Harry and Ginny should have named one of their children after Remus Lupin” thing- to me it was always obvious they didn’t bother because they considered Teddy REMUS Lupin, Harry’s godson, to be as good as their own child.

reblog.comment: I never really got the whole “Harry and Ginny should have named one of their children after Remus Lupin” thing- to me it was always obvious they didn’t bother because they considered Teddy REMUS Lupin, Harry’s godson, to be as good as their own child.

trail.content_raw: I never really got the whole “Harry and Ginny should have named one of their children after Remus Lupin” thing- to me it was always obvious they didn’t bother because they considered Teddy REMUS Lupin, Harry’s godson, to be as good as their own child.
trail.content: I never really got the whole “Harry and Ginny should have named one of their children after Remus Lupin” thing- to me it was always obvious they didn’t bother because they considered Teddy REMUS Lupin, Harry’s godson, to be as good as their own child.

Quotes
blog.description: if y'all gonna send me asks asking "why" can y'all please elaborate a bit more I do a lot of questionable things and don't know what you're referring to

summary:
(Tom and Harry at the store)
Harry: How come macaroni and cheese isn't on every shelf?
Tom: Some people think other food tastes...
body:
(Tom and Harry at the store)
Harry: How come macaroni and cheese isn't on every shelf?
Tom: Some people think other food tastes good, too.
Harry: They're wrong.

dialogue.label: Harry:
dialogue.phrase: How come macaroni and cheese isn't on every shelf?
